intro: Cyphostemma macrocarpum var. minutifolium, commonly known as the small-leaved cyphostemma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cucurbitaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance. Its fruit, which is small and fleshy, is edible and has a sweet, tangy flavor.
